title: Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX)
description: Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX) the Windows work stations are used as X terminals and to run Eclipse (since PC are cheaper than Unix boxes).
OB: When creating a new file, the line delimiter used is the one returned from System.getProperties("line.delimiter"). However, this may not always be what the user wants.
EB: Even if the new file is created on Windows, it should have Unix line delimiters since the end product is a Unix product. A UI (Preference) should be provided to define the line delimiter for new files. Possible values should include Dos / Windows, Mac, Unix, and the default platform line delimiter. The UI should be provided by the Workbench to ensure all plugins use the same line delimiter for new files.
SR:
1. Open Eclipse on a Windows workstation.
2. Create a new file.
3. Verify that the line delimiter used is the one returned from System.getProperties("line.delimiter").
